Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; interior black, with added red and white paint; from top: non-alternating red and white tongues (?) separated by vertical incised lines; red band lined in white; lotus-flower and bud chain with incised outline and red and white details; exterior, cream slip: hindquarters of a lion or panther to right, added red patch on thigh; to left part of a large palmette; filling ornaments of rosettes; below, wide band owith superimposed red band framed in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.274)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
